#Usage of the Base64 encoding function.

= Introduction =

See the following example code for a usage example.<br/>The base64_encode function is a very simple implementation, which is easy to use. 
= Example =
Here, we take the first argument as the input for our encoding function and print the resulting encoded string.
<code>
#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <string.h>

#include "base64.h"
int main()
{
    char *buf;
</code>   
    buf = malloc(strlen(argv[1]));

    // The encoding function.
    // First argument is the string to encode, second argument is the length.
    // The function returns a char`*` to the encoded string.
    buf = b64_encode(argv[1], strlen(argv[1]));

    // Let's print origin and decoded message
    printf("Origin: %s\nDecoded: %s\n", argv[1], buf);

    // Clean up and leave...
    free(buf);
    return 0;
}
</code>
